e4: The CFO's concerns about investor understanding and potential market impact make it risky to switch to the unbiased earnings policy, likely leading to funding difficulties until investors adjust their expectations. While the new policy would be more transparent, the uncertainty involved outweighs the benefits in this scenario.
e5: An ethical reporting policy would provide accurate and unbiased financial information to stakeholders, ensuring fairness, transparency, integrity, and truthfulness. It should also consider avoiding misleading or manipulative representations through complete disclosure, timeliness, and clarity of reporting. Moreover, regular audits or third-party verification can increase accountability, protecting investors in a competitive and rapidly changing market by offering robust oversight mechanisms.
e6: To better understand the potential risks and benefits, I would ask 'What if some investors, even considering themselves knowledgeable, still incorrectly assume the old bias?' Also, 'Have any efforts been made to educate investors on the new, unbiased reporting policy, and what communication strategy the company plans to adopt to mitigate any market reaction?'
q9: Oumuamua (a comet, likely 4Gm x 600m in size) which was first spotted on October 19, 2017.
